pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces `HahnSeries.map` which applies a zero-preserving map to each coefficient. We more or less copy the `Polynomial.map` API.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Sorry for the massive delay in reviewing! This looks absolutely fine.

bors merge

Sorry for the massive delay in reviewing! This looks absolutely fine.

bors merge

Should this allow for `f` to come from an arbitrary `ZeroHomClass`? I see that it works fine for monoid and ring homs elsewhere, presumably using a coercion, so I'm not sure which implementation is better.

It's probably worth mentioning in the module doc that this maps coefficients, where `HahnSeries.embDomain` maps indices.
Thank you, that had not occurred to me.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (RingTheory/HahnSeries) : coefficient-wise map
